intro: Phoebe pickellii, commonly known as the Pickell's phoebe, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Phrymaceae family and is characterized by its small, tubular flowers that typically bloom in spring. The plant has hairy stems and leaves that are oval-shaped with serrated edges. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or arid environments. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
